intro: Dodecatheon jeffreyi var. vivaparum, commonly known as the Jeffrey's glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its foliage consists of broad, ovate leaves with a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
